text: Instead of using the region - based approach of Buckeridge , et al . , we use the individual - based infection scheme of Brookmeyer , et al . [ 17 ] . Although it is known that anthrax spores can survive for long periods of time in the environment , we consider a small scale scenario . Since the population of interest is the individuals attending children ' s emergency departments , we assume an outbreak that affects a fixed number , N say , of children . Brookmeyer , et al . [ 17 ] define the infection probability of an individual exposed to inhalational anthrax using a competing risk model , modeling the dynamics of spore clearance and germination . Let θ represent the hazard rate per unit time ( days , say ) that a spore is cleared from the lung and λ be the rate of germination . Suppose that each individual inhales a dose of D spores .
